name: willed
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
past simple and past participle of
will
will verb
(MAKE HAPPEN)
[ + obj + to infinitive ] If you will something to happen, you try to make it happen by the power of your thoughts: She willed herself to remember his name.
[ I or T ] formal to want something: Stay or go, as you will.

will verb
(LEAVE)
[ T ] to arrange to give money or property to others after your death
